Why do you have to install GTK on the server where I want to start the
stand-alone help system. As I read in the documentation it is a web application
running in a modified version of Tomcat. So why does the system need GTK installed?

Is there a switch to turn of this dependance? My server does not have a
graphical user interface, so no GTK installed!

One of the reasons might be that the default help browser adapter on Linux is 
and SWT window with an embedded Browser widget (using Mozilla).
If your server does not have GUI, why would you run stand-alone help on it?  
You could run infocenter instead.  If it does not work, could you add what 
does not work - what errors are reported?
Konrad

I tried to install the Infocenter. 

First I tried to generate the index for the different language versions of my 
help. This already stopped with an exception because the indexTool could not 
find the GTK lib.

Then I thought maybe the Infocenter itself will run without GTK. But that also 
wants to have GTK installed.

I tried the Motif version and that runs without special installation of a window 
manager or system.

My infocenter call

This command line I tried:
java -classpath plugins/org.eclipse.help.base_3.0.0/helpbase.jar
 org.eclipse.help.standalone.Infocenter -command start -port 8086

and that is the error message I got:
/var/tmp/1/eclipse/eclipse: error while loading shared libraries: libgtk-x11-2.0
.so.0: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

You must add -noexec option to your command, as "eclipse" executable are built 
for specific platforms.

I called this now:

java -classpath plugins/org.eclipse.help.base_3.0.0/helpbase.jar
 org.eclipse.help.standalone.Infocenter -command start -port 8086 -noexec

and got following exception:

java.lang.Exception: Unknown exception.
        at org.eclipse.help.internal.standalone.Eclipse.run(Eclipse.java:121)

Also the documentation which I found here 

http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/~checkout~/org.eclipse.platform.doc.isv
/reference/misc/help_infocenter.html?rev=HEAD&content-type=text/html&only_with_t
ag=R3_0

is not correct for the Motif version of the infocenter. The list in 
the paragraph "[Optional] Installing a minimal set of plug-ins" is incomplete. I 
did not find out which plugin has to stay in the plugins directory but when I 
delete all others except them in the list then Eclipse does not start at all.

I do not have a machine without GTK installed.  The error indicates that 
system launching of eclipse process (the second VM process launched by the 
first VM with the Infocenter class ) failed.  Please check for error logs in 
the workspace and configuration directories.  If they are not there, ensure 
there is not an infocenter started already and running with the same port or 
workspace, or an error in your command.

Launching of the minimal subset of motif build (my eclipse directory has only 
startup.jar and plugins directory with the 10 plug-ins listed) works well for 
me.  In fact this subset is common between motif and gtk builds.

See bug 72690 for related problem.

Can you try running infocenter using just the minimal set of plug-ins:
org.apache.ant
org.apache.lucene
org.eclipse.core.runtime
org.eclipse.help
org.eclipse.help.appserver
org.eclipse.help.base
org.eclipse.help.webapp
org.eclipse.osgi
org.eclipse.tomcat
org.eclipse.update.configurator

without any UI plugins?
Thanks.

Bug 73111 has been fixed in runtime.  It should get you going again when 
having all plug-ins installed.
